etymologies: mid 16th century. From Middle French bastonnade, either from Italian bastonata, or from its cognates Spanish bastonada or Old Occitan bastonada

definitions: A blow with a stick, cane, or similar weapon; a beating delivered in this way. Also (with the): beating of this sort used as a form of corporal punishment.

etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in Robert Johnson. From bastinade

definitions: To beat or thrash (a person) with a stick, cane, or similar weapon, especially on the soles of the feet; = "bastinado".
